channel.title: +Reviews on ऋग्वेदे विश्वासटिप्पन्यः
channel.description: Recent content in +Reviews on ऋग्वेदे विश्वासटिप्पन्यः

item.title: Karen Review
item.description: Speak for itself How the long history of guesswork and commentary on a unique corpus of poetry has rendered it incomprehensible By KAREN THOMSON. Reviewing: Stephanie W. Jamison and Joel P. Brereton, translators THE RIGVEDA, The earliest religious poetry of India Roberto Calasso ARDOR, Translated by Richard Dixon The first translation into English for over a century of the earliest Indo European poetic anthology has at last appeared, the work of two distinguished American indologists.

item.title: MT review
item.description: Talking of academic plagiarism – it is rampant in academic circles, often perpetrated by powerful labs, especially in magazines & high stakes journals but nobody bothers as he powerful can do what they want. Coming to the American strain of white indology 1 could say that the recent translation of the R^igveda into English by 2 American indologists is in a sense a plagiarism because it is in large part a translation of the German translation of the RV by Karl Friedrich Geldner.
